newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan cabinet resigns, new team expected Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Japan cabinet resigns, new team expected Thursday.

text.p: Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto's cabinet, which took office in January, formally resigned after holding a special meeting on Thursday, government sources said.
Hashimoto, who heads the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), is set to be re-elected prime minister when parliament reconvenes at 2 p.m. (0500 GMT) and is expected to name a new cabinet later in the day.
Hashimoto is certain to win the majority of votes in the new 500-seat Lower House on the strength of a loose alliance his party formed last week with the Social Democrats and the tiny Sakigake party.

But Hashimoto in effect will lead a minority government because his party first failed to win a Lower House majority on its own in general elections held last month and then failed to renew a straightforward coalition with its two allies.
As a result, Hashimoto's new 20-member cabinet is expected to be an all-LDP team for the first time since 1993.
